subject: Re: Ikonboard Compromised By Spambots
msgSnippet: Even though I still can t completely recommend using the Ikonboard because the spambots haven t appeared to be removed (although they haven t written any
messageBody:
Even though I still can't completely recommend using the Ikonboard
because the spambots haven't appeared to be removed (although they
haven't written any additional "messages" since 8/4/05), it is
currently the only place to write messages in a Quikscript font. It
really is too bad that no one else has wanted to use it for any length
of time; I check it at least once a day.

I agree that people do have a silly double-standard; They don't like
the current spelling but make no effort to reform it. At least we make
an effort to support a credible alternative.

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "Paul Sandy" <p_g_sandy@h...> wrote:
> It's difficult to learn and stick with if you have no one to
communicate
> with. I have been writing any notes in quickscript, and that helps.
>
> Why is it that most people seem to agree when you point out how
silly the
> written english language is, but think you are crazy for learning a
more
> sensible alternative?
> I'm OK with the "crazy" label, but it seems funny to me.
>
> Paul

Even though I still can't completely recommend using the Ikonboard
because the spambots haven't appeared to be removed (although they
haven't written any additional "messages" since 8/4/05), it is
currently the only place to write messages in a Quikscript font. It
really is too bad that no one else has wanted to use it for any length
of time; I check it at least once a day.

I agree that people do have a silly double-standard; They don't like
the current spelling but make no effort to reform it. At least we make
an effort to support a credible alternative.

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "Paul Sandy" <p_g_sandy@h...> wrote:
> It's difficult to learn and stick with if you have no one to
communicate 
> with. I have been writing any notes in quickscript, and that helps.
> 
> Why is it that most people seem to agree when you point out how
silly the 
> written english language is, but think you are crazy for learning a
more 
> sensible alternative?
> I'm OK with the "crazy" label, but it seems funny to me.
> 
> Paul
